", "answer": "The objective of this scheme is to ameliorate the hardships of the poor and vulnerable sections of society particularly the old and infirm, widows, and persons with disability to secure a dignified life. "}, {"question": "What Were The Amendments Made To The Scheme In The Year 2019? ", "answer": "In 2019, the department enhanced the pension amount of Old Age Pension (OAP), Widow, Weavers, Toddy Tappers, Fishermen, Single Women, Traditional Cobblers, and PLHIV (ART Pensions ) categories to \u20b9 2,250/-, Disabled Pensions to \u20b9 3,000/-, CKDU/Dialysis Pensions to \u20b9 10,000/-, and also reduced the age for Old Age Pensioners (OAP) from 65 to 60 years.

Chronic Kidney Disease patients (Stage3,4 &5) who are not on dialysis and are having the conditions given below: No age limit. a) Serum creatinine of >5mg Consistently on two separate occasions with at least 3 months gap (in Government lab). b) Small contacted kidney on sonographic evaluation (less than 8cm) c) Estimated GFR <15 ml.
> **Reservation / Preference / Priority:** 1.
